definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

sentences.english: Do yuo want to help your family save cash when times are tight ?
sentences.chinese: 既然經濟不景氣，想幫家裏節省開支嗎？

sentences.english: The cost of media is an important but troublesome consideration.
sentences.chinese: 宣傳媒體的開支是件非常重要而又很麻煩的事。

sentences.english: If you commit your finances to God it will probably mean cutting back on your spending.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想讓上帝保佑你財運亨通，那你就得節省開支。

sentences.english: But next year, tax rises will make up nearly half of it.
sentences.chinese: 但明年，稅收的增長將會彌補一半縮減的開支。

sentences.english: Additional expenses come when enlisting the help of porters and guides.
sentences.chinese: 如果你僱傭搬運工和嚮導的話，還回增加額外的開支。

sentences.english: The society was not even in funds to pay its out of pocket disbursements.
sentences.chinese: 該社團甚至沒有經費應付日常開支。

sentences.english: To live in a thrifty way, you need to pay attention to your day-to-day expenses.
sentences.chinese: 若要節儉生活，你需要格外關注日常開支。

sentences.english: You need a budget. Eliminate ALL the nonessential costs in your life.
sentences.chinese: 消滅生活中所有不重要的開支。

sentences.english: Policy-holder is handing in before two years of cost, expenses expenses is larger.
sentences.chinese: 投保人在交費的前兩年，費用開支較大。

sentences.english: Consumers will have to pay more. The motor and garage trades will be harmed.
sentences.chinese: 消費者會增加開支，汽車和車庫生意也會受損。

sentences.english: This he assured me was the only encumbrance.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我這是唯一的額外開支。

sentences.english: The government has committed billions toward defraying the costs of the war.
sentences.chinese: 政府已承諾撥款數十億支付戰爭的開支。

sentences.english: They stuck out against the motion of reducing the spendings.
sentences.chinese: 他們堅決反對削減開支的議案。

sentences.english: This is the total cost of the holiday,taking everything in.
sentences.chinese: 這是假期的總開支，包括了所有的費用。

sentences.english: Each of these are expenses related to your job.
sentences.chinese: 這些開支都是和你的工作相關的。

sentences.english: Policy changes led to a doubling of government spending on health.
sentences.chinese: 政策變化導致了政府在衛生方面的開支加倍。

definition: saving/to save/to use sparingly/to cut down on
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
